723128f-a.text:
St. Nicholas Avenue (old Kingsbridge Road), east side, north from and including 137th Street at Dorrance Brooks Square, showing St. Mark's Methodist Episcopal Church (Negro).  This is the new church edifice erected in 1926 (dedicated December 5).  Edgecomb Avenue begins at this square.  The houses shown here, from 137th to 138th Streets, were built around 1900.

June 24, 1934.
P.L. Sperr
723128f-a.folder: St. Nicholas Avenue & 137th Street, Manhattan, NY

723129f-a.text:
St. Nicholas Ave., east side, south from and including West 138th, to ahhd including West 137th Streets, showing St. Mark's Church (P.E.). The church extends east to Edgecombe Ave. (extreme left) and south on Edgecombe Ave. to West 137th Street. Also shown (extreme right) is a portion of Public School No. 136, at the S.E. corner of Edgecombe Ave., and West 136th Street, and to its left No. 26 Edgecombe Ave., a 3-story
house at the N.E. corner of West 136th Street.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
723129f-a.folder: St. Nicholas Avenue & 137th Street (West), Manhattan, NY
